intro: Oldenlandia latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf moonvine, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its ornamental value is appreciated in gardens, though it can be invasive in some regions.
